intro: Teucrium montanum var. modestum, commonly known as mountain germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
